p:
Butchering and eating of non-human primates through the bushmeat trade probably led to the emergence of HIV.
32, 33 Similarly, Ebola virus has been traced back to the trade in non-human primates, bats, forest antelopes, rodents, and shrews.
34, 35, 36 The Nipah virus, first identified in the Sungai Nipah New Village in Malaysia, spread throughout the region through the trucking of infected pigs.
37
